description: Japan's inflation grew 3.6% year on year in March, marking three straight years that the headline inflation figure is above the Bank of Japan's 2% target.

title: Luigi Mangione indicted for murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO, faces death penalty
description: Luigi Mangione has been indicted on federal charges, including murder with a firearm, for the death of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. The shooting occurred outside a Manhattan hotel in December 2024. US attorney general Pam Bondi is seeking the death penalty, a decision that Mangione's defence team claims is politically motivated, tainting the judicial process.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Florida shooter linked to GOP, old Trump quote resurfaces
description: Following the tragic mass shooting at Florida State University, Phoenix Ikner has been identified as the suspect. Social media users quickly scrutinized his political affiliations, citing voter registration records allegedly listing him as a Republican and resurfacing a 2017 comment on an anti-Trump rally. The weapon used in the shooting belonged to his mother, a Leon County Sheriff’s Deputy.
author: TOI World Desk

title: ICJ hears Sudan case accusing UAE of ‘complicity in genocide’
description: United Arab Emirates says Sudan ‘misusing’ world court in proceedings relating to African nation’s civil warThe international court of justice will rule in the next few weeks on whether the United Arab Emirates can be plausibly found “complicit in the commission of genocide” by arming the Rapid Support Forces militia in Sudan’s civil war.The case was brought by Sudan, whose acting justice minister, Muawia Osman, told the world court in The Hague last week that the country’s “ongoing genocide would not be possible without the complicity of the UAE, including the shipment of arms to the RSF”. Sudan wants ICJ judges to force the UAE to stop its alleged support for the RSF and make “full reparations”, including compensation to victims of the war. Continue reading...
author: Patrick Wintour Diplomatic editor

title: Move over, Med diet – plantains and cassava can be as healthy as tomatoes and olive oil, say researchers
description: Findings from Tanzania’s Kilimanjaro region indicate traditional eating habits in rural Africa can boost the immune system and reduce inflammationPlantains, cassava and fermented banana drink should be added to global healthy eating guidelines alongside the olive oil, tomatoes and red wine of the Mediterranean diet, say researchers who found the traditional diet of people living in Tanzania’s Kilimanjaro region had a positive impact on the body’s immune system.Traditional foods enjoyed in rural villages also had a positive impact on markers of inflammation, the researchers found in a study published this month in the journal Nature Medicine. Continue reading...
author: Kat Lay, Global health correspondent

title: U.S. intelligence contradicts Trump’s justification for mass deportations
description: The determination is the most comprehensive assessment to date undercutting the president’s rationale for deporting suspected Tren de Aragua members without due process.
author: John Hudson, Warren Strobel

title: Macron pushes new format for Ukraine talks after meeting with Rubio
description: European officials appear to be making a concerted effort to intercede in the U.S.-led peace negotiations amid President Trump’s bid for reproachment with Moscow.
author: Adam Taylor, Ellen Francis
